speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: SCENE II. An ante-chamber in the palace.

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Enter Chamberlain, reading a letter

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: 'My lord, the horses your lordship sent for, with

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: all the care I had, I saw well chosen, ridden, and

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: furnished. They were young and handsome, and of the

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: best breed in the north. When they were ready to

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: set out for London, a man of my lord cardinal's, by

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: commission and main power, took 'em from me; with

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: this reason: His master would be served before a

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: subject, if not before the king; which stopped our

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: mouths, sir.'

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: I fear he will indeed: well, let him have them:

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: He will have all, I think.

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Enter, to Chamberlain, NORFOLK and SUFFOLK

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Well met, my lord chamberlain.

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Good day to both your graces.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: How is the king employ'd?

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: I left him private,

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Full of sad thoughts and troubles.

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: What's the cause?

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: It seems the marriage with his brother's wife

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Has crept too near his conscience.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: No, his conscience

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Has crept too near another lady.

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: 'Tis so:

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: This is the cardinal's doing, the king-cardinal:

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: That blind priest, like the eldest son of fortune,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Turns what he list. The king will know him one day.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Pray God he do! he'll never know himself else.

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: How holily he works in all his business!

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: And with what zeal! for, now he has crack'd the league

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Between us and the emperor, the queen's great nephew,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: He dives into the king's soul, and there scatters

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Dangers, doubts, wringing of the conscience,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Fears, and despairs; and all these for his marriage:

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: And out of all these to restore the king,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: He counsels a divorce; a loss of her

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: That, like a jewel, has hung twenty years

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: About his neck, yet never lost her lustre;

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Of her that loves him with that excellence

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: That angels love good men with; even of her

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: That, when the greatest stroke of fortune falls,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Will bless the king: and is not this course pious?

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Heaven keep me from such counsel! 'Tis most true

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: These news are every where; every tongue speaks 'em,

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: And every true heart weeps for't: all that dare

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Look into these affairs see this main end,

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: The French king's sister. Heaven will one day open

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: The king's eyes, that so long have slept upon

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: This bold bad man.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And free us from his slavery.

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: We had need pray,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: And heartily, for our deliverance;

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Or this imperious man will work us all

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: From princes into pages: all men's honours

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Lie like one lump before him, to be fashion'd

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Into what pitch he please.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: For me, my lords,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: I love him not, nor fear him; there's my creed:

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: As I am made without him, so I'll stand,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: If the king please; his curses and his blessings

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Touch me alike, they're breath I not believe in.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: I knew him, and I know him; so I leave him

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: To him that made him proud, the pope.

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Let's in;

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: And with some other business put the king

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: From these sad thoughts, that work too much upon him:

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: My lord, you'll bear us company?

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Excuse me;

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: The king has sent me otherwhere: besides,

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: You'll find a most unfit time to disturb him:

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Health to your lordships.

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Thanks, my good lord chamberlain.

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Exit Chamberlain; and KING HENRY VIII draws the curtain, and sits reading pensively

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: How sad he looks! sure, he is much afflicted.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Who's there, ha?

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Pray God he be not angry.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Who's there, I say? How dare you thrust yourselves

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Into my private meditations?

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Who am I? ha?

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: A gracious king that pardons all offences

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Malice ne'er meant: our breach of duty this way

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: Is business of estate; in which we come

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: To know your royal pleasure.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Ye are too bold:

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Go to; I'll make ye know your times of business:

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Is this an hour for temporal affairs, ha?

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Enter CARDINAL WOLSEY and CARDINAL CAMPEIUS, with a commission

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Who's there? my good lord cardinal? O my Wolsey,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: The quiet of my wounded conscience;

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Thou art a cure fit for a king.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: To CARDINAL CAMPEIUS

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: You're welcome,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Most learned reverend sir, into our kingdom:

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Use us and it.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: To CARDINAL WOLSEY

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: My good lord, have great care

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: I be not found a talker.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Sir, you cannot.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: I would your grace would give us but an hour

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Of private conference.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: [To NORFOLK and SUFFOLK]

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: We are busy; go.

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: [Aside to SUFFOLK]

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: This priest has no pride in him?

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: [Aside to NORFOLK]             Not to speak of:

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: I would not be so sick though for his place:

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: But this cannot continue.

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: [Aside to SUFFOLK]      If it do,

speaker: NORFOLK
text_entry: I'll venture one have-at-him.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: [Aside to NORFOLK]          I another.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Exeunt NORFOLK and SUFFOLK

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Your grace has given a precedent of wisdom

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Above all princes, in committing freely

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Your scruple to the voice of Christendom:

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Who can be angry now? what envy reach you?

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: The Spaniard, tied blood and favour to her,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Must now confess, if they have any goodness,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: The trial just and noble. All the clerks,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: I mean the learned ones, in Christian kingdoms

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Have their free voices: Rome, the nurse of judgment,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Invited by your noble self, hath sent

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: One general tongue unto us, this good man,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: This just and learned priest, Cardinal Campeius;

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Whom once more I present unto your highness.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: And once more in mine arms I bid him welcome,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: And thank the holy conclave for their loves:

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: They have sent me such a man I would have wish'd for.

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: Your grace must needs deserve all strangers' loves,

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: You are so noble. To your highness' hand

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: I tender my commission; by whose virtue,

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: The court of Rome commanding, you, my lord

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: Cardinal of York, are join'd with me their servant

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: In the unpartial judging of this business.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Two equal men. The queen shall be acquainted

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Forthwith for what you come. Where's Gardiner?

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: I know your majesty has always loved her

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: So dear in heart, not to deny her that

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: A woman of less place might ask by law:

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Scholars allow'd freely to argue for her.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Ay, and the best she shall have; and my favour

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: To him that does best: God forbid else. Cardinal,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Prithee, call Gardiner to me, my new secretary:

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: I find him a fit fellow.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Exit CARDINAL WOLSEY

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Re-enter CARDINAL WOLSEY, with GARDINER

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: [Aside to GARDINER]  Give me your hand much joy and

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: favour to you;

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: You are the king's now.

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: [Aside to CARDINAL WOLSEY]

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: But to be commanded

speaker: GARDINER
text_entry: For ever by your grace, whose hand has raised me.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Come hither, Gardiner.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Walks and whispers

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: My Lord of York, was not one Doctor Pace

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: In this man's place before him?

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Yes, he was.

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: Was he not held a learned man?

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Yes, surely.

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: Believe me, there's an ill opinion spread then

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: Even of yourself, lord cardinal.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: How! of me?

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: They will not stick to say you envied him,

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: And fearing he would rise, he was so virtuous,

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: Kept him a foreign man still; which so grieved him,

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: That he ran mad and died.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Heaven's peace be with him!

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: That's Christian care enough: for living murmurers

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: There's places of rebuke. He was a fool;

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: For he would needs be virtuous: that good fellow,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: If I command him, follows my appointment:

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: I will have none so near else. Learn this, brother,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: We live not to be grip'd by meaner persons.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Deliver this with modesty to the queen.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Exit GARDINER

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: The most convenient place that I can think of

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: For such receipt of learning is Black-Friars;

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: There ye shall meet about this weighty business.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: My Wolsey, see it furnish'd. O, my lord,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Would it not grieve an able man to leave

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: So sweet a bedfellow? But, conscience, conscience!

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: O, 'tis a tender place; and I must leave her.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Exeunt
